page.title: 03PORT OF MENTEITH CHURCH
page.content: We have visited the grave of Steven Veitch,the first headmaster of our school who died in 1883. From the Reformation until 1689 the church was Episcopalian.This must have been a troublesome time probably even more dangerous to this individual than life today with its threat of nuclear war.Rev.J.D.McQueen,who was minister from 1915 to 1956 found 2 pewter Communion Cups inscribed "Port Kirk" in the manse garden. It is thought that they may have been buried for safety during the troubles of the Reformation.There are also two silver cups dated 1765 and inscribed "By the Minister and Kirk Session of Port of Menteith for the use of the Said Parish 4th June 1765." The Church is now linked with Aberfoyle Parish Church and shares the services of the Minister, Dr. Orr.
